title: Analysis of Peer Effects and Ability-Based Class Grouping on Academic Achievement

context.prior_knowledge: Requirement of intermediate theoretical background and practical experience
context.additional_context: Case study-centered development of pedagogical methods applicable in actual primary and secondary education settings.

learning_goals: Learners can explain the theoretical foundations of peer effects and present three ability-based classroom grouping strategies.
Learners can design academic achievement improvement plans in classroom environments with students of diverse cognitive abilities.
Learners can interpret empirical research data to derive evidence for educational policy design.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
